required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Smartmesh Technology in Pelvic Floor Repair Procedures
clinical_study.official_title: Etude rétrospective Chez Des Patientes opérées d'un Prolapsus génital Avec l'Implant de Renfort Restorelle Direct Fix : à Propos Des premières Poses en France Entre Janvier 2013 et décembre 2016 (Restorelle).

lead_sponsor.agency: Groupe Hospitalier de la Rochelle Ré Aunis

clinical_study.source: Groupe Hospitalier de la Rochelle Ré Aunis

brief_summary.textblock: Pelvic organ prolapse repair involves conservative treatments and surgical treatments. Conservative treatments are for patients with moderate prolapse. Treatment of symptomatic prolapse remains essentially surgical. According to detailed medical history and a thorough physical exam, surgical techniques may be performed by high abdominal, low vaginal or mixed routes with or without the use of a reinforcing implant. Restorelle Direct Fix is indicated for transvaginal anterior and posterior surgical repair either as mechanical support or as reinforcement of pelvic floor defects. Advantages and disadvantages of vaginal prostheses are known but only limited data have been reported on the use of Restorelle® in the treatment of pelvic organ prolapse. This study is designed to collect data on the safety and efficacy of Restorelle® Direct Fix in pelvic organ prolapse repair.

detailed_description.textblock: Between January 2013 and December 2016, in the participating centers, all adult women who underwent surgery to repair pelvic organ prolapse (recurrent or not) through the vagina with the addition of anterior and/or posterior Restorelle Direct Fix prosthesis are eligible. Collected data are about the peri-operative period and the data available at the last consultation.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with a composite outcome : bladder wound, rectum wound, abnormal bleeding

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with early complications
secondary_outcome.description: Urinary retention, urinary tract infection, hematoma, ureteral complication, second surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with late complications
secondary_outcome.description: self-catheterization, recurrent urinary tract infections, de novo urinary stress incontinence, chronic pain, vaginal prosthesis exposure, prolapse recurrence, secondary surgery, other

secondary_outcome.measure: Pelvic organ prolapse quantification (POP-Q) exam before surgery
Pelvic organ prolapse quantification (POP-Q) exam after surgery
Number of patients with preoperative urinary signs
secondary_outcome.description: urinary stress incontinence, overactive bladder, dysuria, masked urinary incontinence

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with postoperative urinary signs
secondary_outcome.description: urinary stress incontinence, overactive bladder, dysuria, masked urinary incontinence

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with preoperative digestive signs
Number of patients with postoperative digestive signs
Number of patients with preoperative active sexuality
Number of patients with preoperative dyspareunia
Number of patients with postoperative active sexuality
Number of patients with postoperative dyspareunia
Preoperative score at Numeric Pain Rating Scale
secondary_outcome.description: The numeric pain rating scale ranges from 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst pain imaginable)

secondary_outcome.measure: Postoperative score at Numeric Pain Rating Scale
secondary_outcome.description: The numeric pain rating scale ranges from 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst pain imaginable)
The numeric satisfaction scale ranges from 1 (very satisfied) to 7 (very dissatisfied)

intervention.description: Surgery to repair pelvic organ prolapse through the vagina using stitches with the addition of surgical mesh.

study_pop.textblock: Adult women who underwent surgery to repair pelvic organ prolapse (recurrent or not) through the vagina with the addition of anterior and/or posterior Restorelle Direct Fix prosthesis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Over 18
- woman who underwent surgery to repair pelvic organ prolapse (recurrent or not) through the vagina with the addition of anterior and/or posterior Restorelle Direct Fix prosthesis
- informed and not opposed to the use of her data
Exclusion Criteria:
- Opposed to the use of her data

overall_official.affiliation: Groupe Hospitalier de la Rochelle Ré Aunis

facility.name: Groupe Hospitalier de la Rochelle Ré Aunis
Clinique St Michel et St Anne

link.description: Association Française de Normalisation (AFNOR). Norme Française (NF) S 94-801 implants de renfort mis en place par voie vaginale pour cure d'incontinence urinaire d'effort et/ou de prolapsus des organes pelviens. Essais pré-cliniques et essais cliniques
